com.zoiper.zdk.Providers

Class AccountProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.zoiper.zdk.Providers.AccountProvider

  • public class AccountProvider
extends java.lang.Object
    Account information and control provider Manages creation and destruction of user accounts and provides information regarding them.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructor storing the pointer/address to the underlying native object

      • createUserAccount

        public Account createUserAccount()
        Creates a new user account Creates a new user that can be used to register on a server for incoming calls, create outgoing calls, subscribe for presence, etc. This is a mandatory operation before using most of the library's functions. This call will only prepare the structures for the user account. It will not be registered to the server until registerAccount is called (note that registration is not a mandatory operation).
        Returns:
        The newly created user account
        See Also:
        Account

      • deleteUserAccount

        public void deleteUserAccount(Account account)
        Destroys an user account Destroys an user account object and all related structures. If the user has active calls, they will be terminated first.
        Parameters:
        account - The account to be destroyed

      • getAccount

        public Account getAccount(long hAccountId)
        Gets the account with the specified ID Returns the account with the specified ID if exist, otherwise a null pointer is returned.
        Parameters:
        hAccountId - The ID of the requested account
        Returns:
        The requested account if exists or null pointer otherwise

      • setAsDefaultAccount

        public boolean setAsDefaultAccount(Account account)
        Sets the default account
        Parameters:
        account - The default account
        Returns:
        Whether or not the set was successful

      • unregisterAllAccounts

        public void unregisterAllAccounts()
        Unregisters all accounts If the user account is in the process of registration this function will cancel it. If the user was already registered an unregistration process will start. If there is no error the function will return immediately and the final result will be delivered via a callback.
        See Also:
        AccountEventsHandler

      • createAccountConfiguration

        Creates a new empty account configuration
